Excellent jeu. Ni trop difficile ni trop facile, avec quelques pièges et toujours axé sur un besoin de réflexion, même minime. Les solutions ne se présentent pas forcément d'elles-mêmes. Les créatures me font toujours bien flipper, sans qu'il y ait besoin d'une monstruosité atroce ni d'être dans un souterrain sinistre. C'est une ambiance nuancée, subtile et qui vous maintient en haleine !
把黑山基地，half-life 2,ep1,ep2 完整的玩了一遍，标记下，剧情、流程、关卡设计，解密都十分给力。

этот эпизод лучше чем первый в разы. эффекты улучшены, добавлено 3 новых противника (охотник и чертов жук с кислотой, зеленый страж).  аликс уже меньше тупит и бесит чем в 1 эпизоде. в  отличии от первого эпизода тут показали много нового и действия происходили ЗА пределами сити-17. это меня очень порадовало.
плюсы и минусы все те же НО. Откуда у Гордона способность проходить сквозь банку с краской???

J'ai trouvé l'épisode one assez moyen, (très peu d'ajouts, le scénario avance peu) alors que cet épisode est largement meilleur à mon goût. On retrouve les mêmes qualités de gameplay et de gamedesign dans un monde plus ouvert, avec un peu plus de challenge (vers la fin). Le scénario est bien plus intéressant ici.
Franchement allez-y, les 6/7h du jeu valent le coup, surtout si vous avez fait Episode One

Последний на данный момент каноничный эпизод Half-Life раскрывает перед игроком гораздо больше возможностей, нежели предыдущий - разнообразные локации, новые противники, тайники, эпизоды в жанре tower defence, адреналиновые перестрелки с Охотниками, поездки на машине с Аликс, и, конечно, - Битва при Белой Роще, которая представляет из себя один из самых увлекательных эпизодов игровой индустрии в принципе и отпечатывается в памяти игрока на всю жизнь. В целом второй эпизод второй Халфы - это всё то, за что мы полюбили оригинал, но больше, ярче и лучше - идеальный баланс продуманного геймплея, развивающегося лора и красивой графики. Шесть часов чистых эмоций, неподдельного восторга и абсолютно искренние слёзы на финальных титрах.

在今天看来这游戏的设计真是相当古典，但是依旧有趣。看起来是一本道，但是却包含解密要素。并且在需要的时候也会变成一个塔防游戏？
如果在04年能玩到这种游戏肯定会震惊吧。因为2020年看来依旧很出色。

Не сказал бы, что эта игра приносит что-то совершенно новое в обыкновенный Half-Life 2, но всё-таки игра прекрасна! Почему?
*Целых пять новых существ, с которыми мы можем контактировать и убивать.
*Улучшенная графика и совершенно новые эффекты, по типу "Кинематографичной физики", "Портальных штормов".
*Аликс и вортигонты в этой части куда больше, чем просто NPC на нашей стороне.
*История, рассказывающая про то, что произошло после взрыва цитадели, и о том, чем всё это кончилось.
*Новый експириенс)
9/10 точно заслуживает.
хорошо

Episode Two is currently the final Half-Life game. It's a great game, still a bit short, but longer than Episode One. Its quality is also much better than Episode One, so I think it's a must have. Let's keep up the hope for Half-Life 3!

Honestly my most favorite game in the series, This game bring HL2 and Episode one and improves on (Almost) everything! I can not tell you how much replay ability there is and if you do not like a certain part in the story after your first play-through you can just skip over it using the menu! Also the puzzles are fun.

Ok, My favoritism over, lets get through the pro's and con's

PRO's:
Awesome Story
Story progression does not get boring or feels un-needed
Voice-Acting is amazing
Jokes are funny
Enemy placement and weapon placement does not seem out of the ordinary
Alot of replay-ability with the gnome achievement and the difficulties
Overall a fun game.

CON's:
The cave section gets pretty old.
The antlion guard is pretty scary
That damn gnome achievement is so hard to get
The Freeman beacons feel un-needed but are nice puzzles.
[spoiler] Eli getting killed almost made me cry :'( [/spoiler]

Overall i cant really find any MAJOR flaws in episode 2. I feel like its over-all the best Half-Life game. Thats my opinion and i give Half-Life 2 Episode: 2 a 10/10.
Хорошая игра.

I didn't pay attention to this before but Eli tells you it was the G-Man who gave him the crystal sample that caused the Black Mesa incident in the first Half-Life. I dunno if that was retconned or what, don't remember if the scientists say where the sample came from in the first one.

This one seemed longer than the first episode, It's more open with more vehicle sections which i'm not that fond of, the car handles like crap, i think Half-Life is at its best when you're on foot fighting and puzzle solving and not driving around avoiding bombs dropping down or defending a base.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2018294647

Alyx hadn't heard of the Borealis before in this when they mention it so i hope they don't reference this in Half-Life Alyx, also they say how it would be devastating to them if Eli ever got captured and NOT if the combine caught him AGAIN, according to the trailer for Alyx he has been captured before so... *shrugs*

I am curious because at the end the G-Man has Alyx tell Eli to "prepare for unforeseen consequences" and then he gets killed shortly after. I can definitely see this sh*t being retconned in the future to bring him back or something, although it's weird anyway because why tell him that? or am i reading too much into it and it's just to prime the player to expect something bad to happen to him. hmmm.

If you want a resolution to the story then read this.

Half Life is one of my favourite gaming franchises of all time. The original Half Life was seared into my memory as an early teen playing on my ancient Windows 98 PC. It was atmospheric, immersive, compelling, intense, scary, tonnes of fun to play and it redefined the possibilities of what games could do, especially in regards to story telling and world building.

Years later I'd come to feel pretty much the same way about Half Life 2, which took things to a whole new level by creating a virtual playground of advanced physics simulations that allowed you to interact with the world in a way that no other game had ever achieved before. And once again the interactive storytelling and world building drew me in all over again, creating a compelling new world to explore with a cast of wonderfully expressive and sympathetic characters.

All of the above translates into the two episodic entries, especially Episode 2, which is often sited as being the crown jewel of this franchise, and while I still have a soft spot for the original Half Life and Half Life 2, there's no denying that Episode 2 refines and distils everything great about Half Life in a short and sweet package that perhaps has the most compelling narrative of the franchise, and some of the most tense and elaborate set pieces, without ever breaking player immersion and surrounding you with those wonderful characters. Even if the graphics have shown some age, the art direction and level design stand strong to this day. Half Life Episode 2 is still a fantastic experience, a pleasure to return to after all these years. There still aren't too many games like it even now.

Thanks to Half Life Alyx for bringing me back to this franchise after I'd almost lost hope!

Bellissimo mini episodio della saga di HL, ricchissimo per varietà di gameplay (si passa da momenti tower defence ad altri simil oper world nel giro di poche ore), discreto graficamente e con una trama coinvolgente e ben narrata. Speriamo che prima o poi (magari già con Alyx) almeno si concluda la vicenda, lasciata a dir poco tronca da 13 anni a questa parte. Capolavoro.

The last installment in the Half Life series for 13 years. This is the one that ends on a major cliffhanger, probably never to be resolved. The one that started the memes of Valve not being able to count to 3, of Half Life 3 being made and mysteriously scrapped. Despite all that, this expansion is still the Half Life goodness you expect. This time around Gordon has to navigate alien infested caverns, abandoned mining shafts, and gorgeous wilderness on his never ending quest to kick the Combine's ass and save humanity. There were some slight changes to things that were much appreciated, like the flashlight not being tied to the HEV suits AUX power and striders being kept to a minimum and much easier to kill now. Even though the unresolved cliffhanger is an insanely annoying problem, I still recommend this as highly as I can. Maybe someday we'll get a resolution to the stories of Gordon, Alyx, and most importantly Dog, but for now I'm just happy that Valve is at least releasing more content in this universe with Half Life: Alyx. Even if they can never count to 3 there's no denying that Valve knows how to make a game, just not when.

The pretty one of the bunch.

Episode Two has a noticeable makeover compared to the previous Episode and base game. Also of note is that a lot of the experiences and situations feel more new rather than "more of the same". But. I'd honestly have preferred more of the same. There's just some sequences that aren't super fun with the obvious example being the whole sticky-bomb-strider-fight thing. But hey, I sent a gnome to space this time around. So that's something! Episode Two is still obviously a must play and fun most of the time. And the plot and story really starts to grow here too. Which is both good and bad to me. Good that it is a good story, bad in that I preferred the ambiguity and perceived freedom of Half-Life 1. But we already dove in the deep end of plot with the base game of Half-Life 2, so it was nice to see it build up to a story with depth by the end of Episode Two.

It is definitely a beautiful swan, but also the ugly duckling of the bunch in some ways.

Continuando a história deixada pelo primeiro episódio, Half-Life 2: Episode Two se propõe a expandir ainda mais o universo da franquia, continuando o enredo deixado por seu antecessor. Será que eles fizeram jus a franquia? Como eles se saíram expandindo esse mundo? Vale a pena jogá-lo, mesmo sem garantia de uma continuação depois de tanto tempo? É o que vamos ver.

Half-Life 2: Episode Two continua de onde o primeiro episódio parou, cabe a você fugir da destruição da Cidade 17 enquanto lida com o que resta dos Combine, impedindo seu progresso. É aqui que a história se torna mais proeminente, resultando em momentos ainda mais icônicos que o primeiro episódio.

Agora se o game design do Episódio 1 foi ótimo, o do Episódio 2 é ainda melhor. Puzzles de física incríveis, situações empolgantes em combate e um grandioso aproveitamento da engine. Half-Life 2: Episode Two leva os princípios de design de HL2 ao limite.

Pode-se dizer que, devido ao engrandecimento narrativo, Half-Life 2: Episode Two detém o jogador com maior frequência que seu antecessor,  mas esse episódio propulsiona a gameplay para cantos criativos e satisfatórios com sua história. Tudo se complementa com perfeição e por mais que seu cliffhanger doa, a jornada até então continua valendo a pena.

Então sim, Half-Life 2: Episode Two é um jogão, elevando o nome de peso da franquia além das expectativas. Se você não jogou Half-Life ainda, dê uma chance. Você não vai se arrepender.
